author: Upper Echelon
description:
After the US-East-1 Amazon Cloud Hub mega crash... a major portion of the internet was rendered temporarily disabled, in one of the largest outages ever recorded. 

The mistake (and subsequent down time as a result of lackluster precautions) illustrate just how fragile the online world has become, where a few large companies now control a disproportionate amount of traffic and hosting, to a degree where even basic daily necessities can be rendered useless by a single oversight. 

Hyper consolidation creates single points of failure in a system where failure, is extremely dangerous.

title: Single Point of Failure (The Amazon Disaster)
